New Records: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning
Edwin Díaz struck out Kyle Schwarber with two runners aboard to end it
Pre-Game Insights: The NL East champion Phillies, who won 95 games and finished six ahead of the wild-card Mets during the regular season, were looking for the franchise’s third championship
Post-Match Reflections: For the NL East champion Phillies, who won 95 games and finished six ahead of the wild-card Mets during the regular season, it was a bitter exit early in the playoffs and a disappointing step backward
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets' first champagne-soaked clinching celebration in Citi Field’s 16-season history
The Phillies are still looking for the franchise’s third championship
Others: The game was played in New York, and the Mets won 3-1 to wrap up a postseason series at home for the first time in 24 years
